title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine if events A and B are independent, we use the formula:

P(A AND B) $$=$$ P(A) * P(B)

If this equation holds, then the events are independent. If not, they are dependent.

In this case, we have:

P(A AND B) $$=$$ $$0.02$$
P(A) $$=$$ $$0.1$$
P(B) $$=$$ $$0.2$$

So, to check if the events are independent, we plug in the values:

$$0.02$$ $$=$$ $$0.1$$ * $$0.2$$

Simplifying, we get:

$$0.02$$ $$=$$ $$0.02$$

Since the equation holds, we conclude that events A and B are independent.
